snippet: Police and protesters faced off in the capital, Male, and the island nation’s former president said he was forced at gunpoint to resign this week.
abstract: The Maldives is gripped by violent clashes between police and protesters in the wake of turmoil caused by the unexpected resignation of President Mohamed Nasheed, who was elected in 2008 in the country’s first democratic presidential election; his resignation has prompted claims and counterclaims about whether he was actually deposed in a coup; Nasheed implicates his successor, Mohamed Waheed Hassan, who had been vice president before being sworn into office as president.

byline.contributor: Sruthi Gottipati and Hari Kumar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Police and protesters faced off in the capital, Male, and the island nation’s former president said he was forced at gunpoint to resign this week.

headline.main: Clashes Continue in Maldives as the Former President Takes Part in a March
headline.print_headline: Clashes Continue in Maldives as the Former President Takes Part in a March
